starting_area.1: Square, 20 x 20 ft.; passage on each wall
starting_area.2: Square, 20 x 20 ft.; door on two walls, passage in third wall
starting_area.3: Square, 40 x 40 ft.; doors on three walls
starting_area.4: Rectangle, 80 x 20 ft., with row of pillars down the middle; two passages leading from each long wall, doors on each short wall
starting_area.5: Rectangle, 20 x 40 ft.; passage on each wall
starting_area.6: Circle, 40 ft. diameter; one passage at each cardinal direction
starting_area.7: Circle, 40 ft. diameter; one passage in each cardinal direction; well in middle of room (might lead down to lower level)
starting_area.8: Square, 20 x 20 ft.; door on two walls, passage on third wall, secret door on fourth wall

passage.1..2: Continue straight 30 ft., no doors or side passages
passage.3: Continue straight 20 ft., door to the right, then an additional 10 ft. ahead
passage.4: Continue straight 20 ft., door to the left, then an additional 10 ft. ahead
passage.5: Continue straight 20 ft., passage ends in a door
passage.6..7: Continue straight 20 ft., side passage to the right, then an additional 10 ft. ahead
passage.8..9: Continue straight 20 ft., side passage to the left, then an additional 10 ft. ahead
passage.10: Continue straight 20 ft., comes to a dead end. 10% chance of a secret door ({{ roll raw:1d100 }} <= 10)
passage.11..12: Continue straight 20 ft., then the passage turns left and continues 10 ft.
passage.13..14: Continue straight 20 ft., then the passage turns right and continues 10 ft.

passage_width.17: 40 ft., with row of pillars down the middle
passage_width.18: 40 ft., with double row of pillars
passage_width.20: 40 ft. wide, 20 ft. high, gallery 10 ft. above floor allows access to level above

beyond_a_door.1..2: Passage extending 10 ft., then T intersection extending 10 ft. to the right and left

chambers.1..2: Square, 20 x 20 ft. (Normal Chamber, {{ roll raw:normal chamber exits:1d20 }} exits)
chambers.3..4: Square, 30 x 30 ft. (Normal Chamber, {{ roll raw:normal chamber exits:1d20 }} exits)
chambers.5..6: Square, 40 x 40 ft. (Normal Chamber, {{ roll raw:normal chamber exits:1d20 }} exits)
chambers.7..9: Rectangle, 20 x 30 ft. (Normal Chamber, {{ roll raw:normal chamber exits:1d20 }} exits)
chambers.10..12: Rectangle, 30 x 40 ft. (Normal Chamber, {{ roll raw:normal chamber exits:1d20 }} exits)
chambers.13..14: Rectangle, 40 x 50 ft. (Large Chamber, {{ roll raw:large chamber exits:1d20 }} exits)
chambers.15: Rectangle, 50 x 80 ft. (Large Chamber, {{ roll raw:large chamber exits:1d20 }} exits)
chambers.16: Circle, 30 ft. diameter (Normal Chamber, {{ roll raw:normal chamber exits:1d20 }} exits)
chambers.17: Circle, 50 ft. diameter (Large Chamber, {{ roll raw:large chamber exits:1d20 }} exits)
chambers.18: Octagon, 40 x 40 ft. (Large Chamber, {{ roll raw:large chamber exits:1d20 }} exits)
chambers.19: Octagon, 60 x 60 ft. (Large Chamber, {{ roll raw:large chamber exits:1d20 }} exits)
chambers.20: Trapezoid, roughly 40 x 60 ft. (Large Chamber, {{ roll raw:large chamber exits:1d20 }} exits)

exit_location.1..7: Wall opposite entrance ({{ roll raw:exit type:1d20 }})
exit_location.8..12: Wall left of entrance ({{ roll raw:exit type:1d20 }})
exit_location.13..17: Wall right of entrance ({{ roll raw:exit type:1d20 }})
exit_location.18..20: Same wall as entrance ({{ roll raw:exit type:1d20 }})

stairs.1..4: Down one level to a chamber
stairs.5..8: Down one level to a passage 20 ft. long
stairs.9: Down two levels to a chamber
stairs.10: Down two levels to a passage 20 ft. long
stairs.11: Down three levels to a chamber
stairs.12: Down three levels to a passage 20 ft. long
stairs.13: Up one level to a chamber
stairs.14: Up one level to a passage 20 ft. long
stairs.17: Chimney up one level to a passage 20 ft. long
stairs.18: Chimney up two levels to a passage 20 ft. long
stairs.19: Shaft (with or without elevator) down one level to a chamber
stairs.20: Shaft (with or without elevator) up one level to a chamber and down one level to a chamber

temple_or_shrine_rooms.1..3: Armoury filled with weapons and armour, battle banners, and pennants
temple_or_shrine_rooms.4..5: Audience chamber where priests of the temple receive commoners and low-ranking visitors
temple_or_shrine_rooms.6..7: Banquet room used for celebrations and holy days
temple_or_shrine_rooms.8..10: Barracks for the temple's military arm or its hired guards
temple_or_shrine_rooms.11..14: Cells where the faithful can sit in quiet contemplation
temple_or_shrine_rooms.15..24: Central temple built to accomodate rituals
temple_or_shrine_rooms.25..28: Chapel de3dicated to a lesser deity associated with the temple's major deity
temple_or_shrine_rooms.29..31: Classroom used to train initiates and priests
temple_or_shrine_rooms.32..34: Conjuring room, specially sanctified and used to summon extraplanar creatures
temple_or_shrine_rooms.35..40: Crypt for a high priest or similar figure, hidden and heavily guarded by creatures and traps
temple_or_shrine_rooms.41..42: Dining room (large) for the temple's servants and lesser priests
temple_or_shrine_rooms.43: Dining room (small) for the temple's high priests
temple_or_shrine_rooms.44..46: Divination room, inscribed with runes and stocked with soothsaying implements
temple_or_shrine_rooms.47..50: Dormitory for lesser priests or students
temple_or_shrine_rooms.57: Kennel for animals or monsters associated with the temple's deity
temple_or_shrine_rooms.58..60: Kitchen (Might bear a disturbing resemblance to a torture chamber in an evil temple)
temple_or_shrine_rooms.61..65: Library, well stocked with religious treatises
temple_or_shrine_rooms.66..68: Prison for captured enemies (in good or neutral temples) or those designated as sacrifices (in evil temples)
temple_or_shrine_rooms.69..73: Robing room containing ceremonial outfits and items
temple_or_shrine_rooms.74: Stable for riding horses and mounts belonging to the temple, or for visiting messengers and caravans
temple_or_shrine_rooms.80: Strong room or vault holding important relics and ceremonial items, heavily trapped
temple_or_shrine_rooms.81..82: Torture chamber, used in inquisitions (in good or neutral temples with a lawful bent) or for the sheer joy of causing pain (evil temples)
temple_or_shrine_rooms.83..89: Trophy room where art celebrating key figures and events from mythology is displayed
temple_or_shrine_rooms.91..94: Well for drinking water, defensible in the case of attack or siege
temple_or_shrine_rooms.95..100: Workshop for repairing or creating weapons, religious items, and tools

treasure_vault_rooms.2: Armoury containing mundane and magic gear used by the treasure vault's guards
treasure_vault_rooms.10: Kennel for trained beasts used to guard the treasure vault
treasure_vault_rooms.12: Watch room that allows guards to observe those who approach the dungeon
treasure_vault_rooms.14..15: Strong room or vault, for guarding the treasure hidden in the dungeon, accessible only by locked or secret door
treasure_vault_rooms.16: Torture chamber for extracting information from captured intruders
treasure_vault_rooms.17..20: Trap or other trick designed to kill or capture creatures that enter the dungeon

dungeon_chamber_contents.28..33: Monster (pet or allied creature) guarding treasure
dungeon_chamber_contents.51..58: Dungeon Hazard with incidental treasure ({{ roll raw:dungeon hazard:1d20 }})
dungeon_chamber_contents.89..94: Empty room with dungeon hazard ({{ roll raw:dungeon hazard:1d20 }})

monster_motivation.6..8: Seek an item in the dungeon

dungeon_obstacle.1: Antilife aura with a radius of {{ roll raw:1d10 }} (1d1) x 10 ft.; while in the aura, living creatures can't regain hit points
dungeon_obstacle.2: Battering winds reduce speed by half, impose disadvantage on ranged attack rolls
dungeon_obstacle.9..12: Chasm {{ roll raw:1d4 }} (1d4) x 10 ft. wide and {{ roll raw:2d6 }} (2d6) x 10 ft. deep, possibly connected to other levels of the dungeon
dungeon_obstacle.13..14: Flooding leaves {{ roll raw:2d10 }} (2d10) ft. of water in the area; create nearby upward-sloping passages, raised floors, or rising stairs to contain the water
dungeon_obstacle.15: Lava flows through the area (50% chance of a stone bridge crossing it, {{ roll raw:1d100 }} ≤ 50)
dungeon_obstacle.16: Overgrown mushrooms block progress and must be hacked down (25% chance of a mold or fungus dungeon hazard hidden among them, {{ roll raw:1d100 }} ≤ 25)
dungeon_obstacle.17: Poisonous gas (deals 1d6 poison damage per minute of exposure)
dungeon_obstacle.18: *Reverse gravity* effect causes creatures to fall toward the ceiling

dungeon_trap_effects.1..4: *Magic Missiles* shoot from a statue or object
dungeon_trap_effects.5..7: Collapsing staircase creates a ramp that deposits characters into a pit at its lower end.
dungeon_trap_effects.8..10: Ceiling block falls, or entire ceiling collapses.
dungeon_trap_effects.11..12: Ceiling lowers slowly in locked room
dungeon_trap_effects.17..19: Touching an object triggers a *disintegrate* spell
dungeon_trap_effects.20..23: Door or other object is coated with contact poison
dungeon_trap_effects.24..27: Fire shoots out from wall, floor, or object
dungeon_trap_effects.28..30: Touching an object triggers a *flesh to stone* spell
dungeon_trap_effects.31..33: Floor collapses or is an illusion
dungeon_trap_effects.34..36: Vent releases gas: blinding, acidic, obscuring, paralysing, poisonous, or sleep-inducing
dungeon_trap_effects.44..46: Huge wheeled statue rolls down corridor
dungeon_trap_effects.47..49: *Lightning Bolt* shoorts from wall or object
dungeon_trap_effects.50..52: Locked room floods with water or acid
dungeon_trap_effects.53..56: Darts shoot out of an opened chest
dungeon_trap_effects.57..59: A weapon, suit of armour, or rug animates and attacks when touched (See "Animated Objects" in the Monster Manual)
dungeon_trap_effects.60..62: Pendulum, either bladed or weighted as a maul, swings across the room or hall
dungeon_trap_effects.63..67: Hidden pit opens beneath characters (25% chance that a black pudding or gelatinous cube fills the bottom of the pit, {{ roll raw:1d100 }} ≤ 25)
dungeon_trap_effects.68..70: Hidden pit floods with acid or fire
dungeon_trap_effects.74..77: Scything blade emerges from wall or object
dungeon_trap_effects.85..88: *Thunderwave* knocks characters into a pit or spikes
dungeon_trap_effects.89..91: Steel or stone jaws restrain a character

trick_object.13: Runes engraved on wall or floor

tricks.1..3: Ages the first person to touch the object
tricks.4..6: The touched object animates, or it animates other objects nearby
tricks.7..10: Asks three skill-testing questions (if all three are answered correctly, a reward appears)
tricks.14..16: Changes a character's alignment, personality, size, appearance, or sex when touched
tricks.17..19: Changes one substance to another, such as gold to lead or metal to brittle crystal
tricks.27..29: Suppresses magic items for a time
tricks.45..47: Flies about to avoid being touched
tricks.51..53: Increases, reduces, negates, or reverses gravity
tricks.63..65: Offers a game of chance, with the promise of a reward or valuable information
tricks.66..68: Helps or harms certain types of creatures
tricks.79..81: Releases coins, false coins, gems, false gems, a magic item, or a map
tricks.82..84: Releases, summons, or turns into a monster
tricks.91..93: Talks (normal speech, nonsense, poetry and rhymes, singing, spellcasting, or screaming)
tricks.98..100: Swaps two or more characters minds
